text: The Kromme Waal is a street in Amsterdam between the Prins Hendrikkade and the Oude Waal. From Kraansluis (bridge 300, in the Prins Hendrikkade) to Waalseilandbrug (bridge 283), the street forms the western quay of the Waalseilandsgracht, the old inner harbor of Amsterdam between the Montelbaanstoren and the IJ. ==Trivia == *The architect Bernard Bijvoet (1889-1979) was born here. *A photo of a tugboat in the Kromme Waal adorns the cover of The Beach Boys' album Holland (1973). File:Hilda und Hausboote, Kromme Waal Amsterdam-2.jpg |Houseboats on the Waalseilandgracht and houses on the Kromme Waal street (June 2017) File:Waalseilandsgracht, foto 5 Jacob Olie (max res).jpg |Kromme Waal looking north towards bridge 300, 1897 ==Notes== ==Sources== Category:Streets in Amsterdam
title: Kromme Waal
